thread.title: Iraq and Syria refugees warned no to move to Australia | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Iraq and Syria refugees warned no to move to Australia | Daily Mail Online

author: Nelson Groom For Daily Mail Australia
title: Iraq and Syria refugees warned no to move to Australia | Daily Mail Online
text: Share The council expects another 3000 to arrive in 2017. 'Sydney, in general, is the wrong area for them. Especially if you're trying to build your life,' Mr Haroom said. Australian-born Assyrian Bianca Mikhael said the humanitarian arrivals has led to skyrocketing rental prices. Syrian refugee Clara Asparti has told of the challenges of entering the rental market in Sydney Fairfield City Council will be home to half of the Syrian and Iraqi refugees coming to Australia (pictured: Syrian refugees entering the Greek island of Lesbos) Of the 12,000 refugees to be settled in Australia in 2017, at least 6,000 of them are expected to call the municipality of Fairfield home 'It's a good thing for them to come and to be able to have that life that we have. But from the other side, we're getting pushed,' Ms Mikhael said. 'Actually, in Fairfield, it's too crowded.' Other newcomers in the area have cautioned the hurdles of rebuilding their lives, such as Clara Asparti, a trained dental technitian in Syria. 'In order to rent the house you have to have a rental history, and you can't have a rental history if nobody rents your house from the beginning.'
